item.title: 高盛和桑坦德银行是探索区块链货币的银行之一
item.description: 包括高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.）、德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）、美国银行（Bank of America Corp）和桑坦德银行（Banco Santander）在内的一批国际银行已联手探索在公共区块链上发行 "数字货币"，这标志着大型金融机构在研究加密货币支付技术的可能用途方面取得了最新进展。【原文：A group of international banks including Goldman Sachs Group Inc., Deutsche Bank AG, Bank of America Corp. and Banco Santander, have joined forces to explore the issuance of “digital money” on public blockchains, marking the latest push by large financial institutions to examine possible uses for the technology underpinning cryptocurrencies for payments.】

item.title: 债务投资者对受人工智能冲击的公司越来越警惕
item.description: 债务投资者越来越担心那些有可能因人工智能而被淘汰的公司，这使得一些公司更难筹集到资金。【原文：Debt investors are growing more concerned about companies that are at risk of becoming obsolete because of artificial intelligence, making it harder for some corporations to raise money.】

item.title: 化肥厂问题加重关税不利因素，马赛克公司业绩下滑
item.description: 化肥公司 Mosaic Co. 的股价下跌，原因是磷酸盐工厂的运营问题影响了生产，给本已受到美国关税影响的化肥行业增加了压力。【原文：Shares of fertilizer company Mosaic Co. dropped as operational issues at phosphate plants hit production, adding pressure to a segment already suffering from US tariffs.】

item.title: 调查显示，企业为人工智能支付过高费用增加了泡沫风险
item.description: 最新的《市场脉搏》（Markets Pulse）调查显示，越来越多的人怀疑企业在人工智能方面是否物有所值。这让人们更加担心，16 万亿美元从熊市边缘反弹的势头已接近爆发点。【原文：There’s growing doubt that firms are getting what they pay for when it comes to artificial intelligence, the latest Markets Pulse survey showed. That’s adding to concerns the $16 trillion rally from the brink of a bear market is nearing its breaking point.】

item.title: 人工智能的发展让金融监管机构苦苦追赶
item.description: 全球金融监管机构周五警告说，监管机构在努力跟踪人工智能的快速应用给金融系统带来的风险方面仍处于 "早期阶段"。【原文：Regulators are still at an “early stage” in their efforts to track the risks posed to the financial system by the rapid adoption of artificial intelligence, global financial watchdogs warned on Friday.】

item.title: 苹果终于加入亚洲最大潮流之一，推出 iPhone 斜挎包带
item.description:
亚洲的科技购物者可以享受到种类繁多的手机带，而且价格低于苹果公司的要求。【原文：

Tech shoppers in Asia enjoy a wide assortment of phone straps, at lower prices than what Apple is asking.

】

item.title: 美国消费者信心因就业和物价担忧而持续低迷
item.description: 10 月初，美国消费者情绪变化不大，因为美国人预计就业市场或通胀不会有太大改善。【原文：US consumer sentiment was little changed in early October as Americans expect scant improvement in the job market or inflation.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行在美国购买阿根廷比索支持米莱公司的过程中发挥关键作用
item.description: 当美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周四决定在市场上购买阿根廷比索以支撑南美经济时，并没有求助于美国银行。而是选择了西班牙桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）。【原文：When US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent decided Thursday to buy Argentine pesos in the market to shore up the South American economy, it didn’t turn to a US bank. Instead it chose Spain’s Banco Santander SA.】

item.title: PE 公司 Ardian 据称寻求出售配料制造商 Frulact
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，欧洲私募股权公司 Ardian 正在探讨出售 Frulact 的可能性，Frulact 是一家以天然水果和植物为基础的特种配料生产商。【原文：European private equity firm Ardian is exploring a potential sale of Frulact, a producer of natural fruit-based and plant-based specialty ingredients, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 量子公司 IonQ 从苏斯克汉纳高地融资 20 亿美元
item.description: 量子计算运营商 IonQ 公司向苏斯克汉纳国际集团（Susquehanna International Group）的一家关联公司出售股票和预付认股权证，筹集了 20 亿美元资金。【原文：Quantum computing operator IonQ Inc. raised $2 billion in a sale of shares and pre-funded warrants to an affiliate of Susquehanna International Group, as firms increasingly invest in the technology.】

item.title: 卢旺达将于明年向国际货币基金组织寻求新的资助计划
item.description: 卢旺达财政部表示，卢旺达将于三月份向国际货币基金组织寻求新的资助计划。【原文：Rwanda will seek a new funded program from the International Monetary Fund in March, according to its Finance Ministry.】

item.title: 洛杉矶时报》计划在 2027 年上市前融资 5 亿美元
item.description: 洛杉矶时报》和其他数字媒体资产的所有者正准备上市，在 2027 年进行规模较小的首次公开募股之前，将筹集多达 5 亿美元的优先股。【原文：The owner of the Los Angeles Times newspaper and other digital media assets is readying to go public by raising as much as $500 million in preferred stock ahead of a smaller initial public offering in 2027.】

item.title: 在 Meta 大数据中心的带动下，Entergy 希望建造更多天然气设施
item.description: Entergy 公司已申请将新的天然气发电接入路易斯安那州的电网，以满足该州新建数据中心和工业项目日益增长的需求。【原文：Entergy Corp. has applied to connect new natural gas generation to the grid in Louisiana to meet increasing demand from new data centers and industrial projects in the state.】

item.title: 停摆不确定性持续存在，美股有望实现周线上涨
item.description: 周五开盘后不久，美国股市悄然走高，主要股指仍有望实现周线上涨，因为投资者正在等待消费者信心数据，以获得有关经济健康状况的新线索。【原文：US stocks crept higher shortly after the opening bell on Friday, with major stock indexes still on track for weekly gains as investors await consumer sentiment data for fresh clues on the health of the economy.】

item.title: 智利电信公司证实母公司正在出售业务部门
item.description: Telefonica Chile 周五证实，其母公司西班牙电信公司（Telefonica SA —）正在出售智利电信公司。【原文：Telefonica Chile confirmed Friday that its parent company — Spain’s Telefonica SA — is selling the local unit.】

item.title: 铜需求飙升，赞比亚克瓦查汇率创 2024 年以来新高
item.description: 赞比亚货币升至近两年来的最高水平，延续了该国铜业信心推动下的涨势。【原文：Zambia’s currency rose to the highest level in almost two years, extending a rally driven by confidence in the country’s copper industry.】

item.title: Kalshi 以 50 亿美元估值筹集资金，向海外扩张
item.description: 预测市场 Kalshi Inc. 在最新一轮融资中获得了 50 亿美元的估值，比几个月前的融资额翻了一番还多。【原文：Predictions marketplace Kalshi Inc. secured a $5 billion valuation in its latest funding round, more than double the amount cited during its previous fund raising effort just months ago.】

item.title: 有迹象表明政府停摆正在损害经济，国债上涨
item.description: 由于有证据表明美国政府停摆可能会抑制经济活动，交易员们对此做出了反应，周五国债走高。【原文：Treasuries advanced Friday as traders reacted to evidence the US government shutdown may be curtailing economic activity.】

item.title: 高盛分析：美国初请失业金人数增至23.5万
item.description: 根据高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits rose last week, according to a Goldman Sachs Group Inc. analysis of state-level filings released during the federal government shutdown.】

item.title: 铅价摆脱创纪录的预定交货库存的影响
item.description: 由于全球库存仍接近 12 年来的最高水平，伦敦金属交易所新加坡仓库的订单创下了历史新高，交易商们摆脱了压力，铅价随之下跌。【原文：Lead prices fell as traders shrugged off record orders from London Metal Exchange warehouses in Singapore, with global stockpiles still near a 12-year high.】

item.title: Adnoc Gas 首席执行官表示，创纪录的液化天然气浪潮将催生长期需求
item.description: Adnoc Gas 公司的一位高管表示，到本世纪末，液化天然气的供应量将急剧增加，这将带来持续不断的需求。【原文：A looming surge in liquefied natural gas supply through the end of the decade is poised to create demand that won’t go away, said an Adnoc Gas executive.】

item.title: 中国反击美国港口收费，航运市场陷入困境
item.description: 在中国政府对美国船只实施报复性征税之后，一些向亚洲第一大消费国运送原油和其他商品的中国航线船只面临取消，这在全球物流业掀起了涟漪。【原文：Some China-bound ships carrying crude oil and other commodities to Asia’s top consumer are facing cancellations following Beijing’s retaliatory levies on American vessels, sending ripples through the global logistics sector.】

item.title: 加拿大就业人数增加 6.04 万人，失业率维持在 7.1
item.description: 加拿大经济增加的就业岗位多于预期，但失业率保持稳定，因为有更多的人加入了劳动力大军。【原文：The Canadian economy added more jobs than expected but the unemployment rate held steady as more people entered the workforce.】

item.title: 加拿大赴美旅游人数连续第九个月下滑
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的贸易战和边境打压政策的影响下，上个月加拿大赴美旅游人数继续急剧下降。【原文：Canadian travel to the US continued its steep decline last month amid President Donald Trump’s trade war and border crackdown.】

item.title: 可可需求下滑，创 1999 年以来最长周跌幅
item.description: 尽管供应前景有所改善，但需求持续疲软，纽约可可期货将创下 26 年多来最长的周跌幅。【原文：Cocoa futures in New York are set for their longest run of weekly losses in more than 26 years, weighed by continuing demand weakness even as the supply outlook improves.】

item.title: 卢拉推出住房融资计划，着眼于巴西 2026 年大选
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）将宣布一项新计划，以更低廉的信贷刺激巴西的住房市场，继续努力在 2026 年竞选连任之前巩固自己的声望。【原文：President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will announce a new plan to boost Brazil’s housing market with cheaper credit, continuing his efforts to shore up his popularity ahead of a 2026 reelection bid.】

item.title: 土耳其 5000 亿美元黄金囤积令抗击通胀形势更加复杂
item.description: 黄金价格的上涨使土耳其家庭的财富增加了数十亿美元，从而使中央银行控制价格的努力变得更加复杂。【原文：A rally in gold prices is lifting the wealth of Turkish households by billions of dollars, complicating the central bank’s efforts to rein in prices.】

item.title: 宾夕法尼亚州希望离开美国最大的电网。这并不容易。
item.description: 当宾夕法尼亚州、新泽西州和马里兰州的公用事业公司建立起今天美国最大的电网时，他们的目标是以尽可能低的价格提供电力。但近 70 年后，确保电力供应的成本已飙升至历史新高，这促使宾夕法尼亚州州长乔希-夏皮罗（Josh Shapiro）威胁要退出这个目前由 13 个州组成的电网。【原文：When utilities from Pennsylvania, New Jersey and Maryland established what is today the largest US grid, they aimed to provide power at the lowest possible price. But nearly 70 years later, the cost of securing power has surged to record highs, prompting Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro to threaten to leave the now-13-state network.】

item.title: 杰克-多西的区块链公司在最新行动中瞄准银行卡网络收费
item.description: 杰克-多尔西（Jack Dorsey）的 Block 公司正在重新推动更多商家使用其支付网络，并将其视为信用卡巨头维萨卡公司（Visa）和万事达卡公司（Mastercard Inc.【原文：Jack Dorsey’s Block Inc. is making a renewed push to get more merchants using its payments network, which it casts as a less expensive alternative to credit-card behemoths Visa Inc. and Mastercard Inc.】

item.title: 沃勒称就业市场最令人担忧，薪资可能为负值
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）表示，过去几个月的就业增长可能一直是负增长，劳动力市场现在是他最担心的问题。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said job growth has probably been negative for the last few months and the labor market is now his biggest concern.】
